intro: Tetraplasandra gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded tetrastigma, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, spherical berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
